ygData.subject: Re: Possible reason invisibility fails sometimes
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Errr.... Not true.  I ve used ITU to walk past them several times with no effect.  I ve also had them attack me twice when ITU was up.  This seems to
ygData.messageBody:
>Message: 23
> Date: Thu, 06 Jan 2000 12:06:21 -0700
> From: Randy Keith <Kalekona@...>
>Subject: Re: Possible reason invisibility fails sometimes
>
>Heh, Gibs see invis to undead. Period. =)

Errr.... Not true. I've used ITU to walk past them several times with no
effect. I've also had them attack me twice when ITU was up. This seems to
support the idea that they simply have a higher-than average intelligence
check against that spell, or that the "random" (hehehe) number generator
just acted up.

Something else I have noticed - bardic invisibility seems to be superior to
any other single concealment spell (invisibility or invisibility to undead
spells) insofar as it fails less often. Many's the time I've wandered Cazic
or Unrest, dancing through the halls while around me monsters stood waiting.
I don't ever recall anything in either of those zones seeing through my
invis. Could be that our invisibility has a lower-than-average intelligence
check...

Aloro Silvertongue (E'ci)
